translations: n.（音乐、数学等的）标记系统，成套符号，标记法；注释，评注

sentences.sentence: He recognizes enough notation to be able to follow a score.
sentences.translation: 他认识足够多的音乐符号，能看懂乐谱。

sentences.sentence: Musical notation was conceived for the C major scale and each line and space represents a note in this scale.
sentences.translation: 乐谱为C大音阶而构思，在这个音阶中的每一个线和间都代表一个音符。

sentences.sentence: He believes that as far back as 30,000 B.C., hunters may have used a system of notation, engraved on bone and stone, to mark phases of the Moon.
sentences.translation: 他认为，远在公元前30,000年以前，猎人可能会用一套刻在骨头和石头上的符号系统来标记月相。
